name: Deadbug
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs lifted, forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your lower back does not arch upwards throughout the movement.
3. Slowly lift your right leg 6-8 inches off the ground while simultaneously lowering your left arm towards the ground.
4. Hold the position for a brief moment, focusing on maintaining engagement in your core muscles and keeping your lower back stable.
5. Slowly return to the starting position by bringing your left arm back up and lowering your right leg down to the ground.
6. Repeat on the opposite side with your left leg lifted and right arm lowered.
7. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control and core engagement throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Deadbug is an abs-focused exercise that works multiple muscle groups in a controlled movement.
alternative_names: Lying Leg Raise with Arm Lowering
